page.title: 11Farming/Ecology
page.content: Guy Sudlow lives in a modern bungalow at Priory Farm,Wheathill.A young go-ahead farmer,he cultivates with 1 assistant,500 acres of mainly arable land,growing good quality wheat for bread and barley for cattle feed. He also fattens 26 beef cattle. Spotless buildings house the latest in agricultural machinery but this no longer includes a light aircraft for crop spraying."More care must be taken with chemicals these days,"says Mr Sudlow."Indiscriminate spraying harms wildlife and conservation is an important part of farming".The job is now done by a narrow wheeled tractor and sprayer which run between the rows of corn without damaging the plants.60 tons of artificial fertilizer plus farmyard manure prepare the clay soil each year for cereals,peas,beans and oil seed rape.
